Header: Batting today was easier than against Afghanistan – Lahiru Thirimanne
Content: Addressing the post match press conference after Sri Lanka’s crushing nine-wicket victory over England in their World Cup Pool A clash on Sunday centurion Lahiru Thirimanne stated compared to the pace attack he faced when batting against Afghanistan, today’s game was far easier. Both Thirimanne and his opening partner T.M. Dilshan were dismissed for golden ducks in the game against Afghanistan which Sri Lanka won by 4 wickets . Speaking on the Sri Lankan top order, Thirimanne expressed delight that all 4 of the Sri Lankan top order batsmen are in form. However he cautioned that this is not the end and that they needed to perform equally well against Australia. Meanwhile England’s Eoin Morgan said that they didn’t put sides under pressure and create opportunities when bowling in today’s game. Morgan noted that the English bowlers failed to put pressure on the Sri Lankan batsmen today and this led to their failure.
